Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Legal_Provision_Involved: s. 41(e) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to challenge Commission's jurisdiction and procedural fairness
Evidence_Requirement: Demonstration of unreasonable prejudice due to delay
Institutional_Action: Commission allowed late-filed complaint and proceeded with investigation
Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Procedural fairness not breached, no undue prejudice
Evidence_Type: Temporal delay, impact assessment, procedural conduct
Jurisdiction: Federal jurisdiction under the Canadian Human Rights Act
Assessment_Standard: Appropriateness of extending time limit under s. 41(e)
Complaint_Issues: Late filing of complaint, procedural fairness, jurisdiction
Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness, reasonableness of administrative decision
Protection_Claim: Right to file human rights complaint despite late filing
Risk_Factor: Delay in filing leading to potential prejudice
Credibility: Not directly challenged; focus on procedural fairness
Legal_Provision: s. 41(e) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
State_Protection_Adequacy: Adequate; Commission acted within statutory authority
Enforcement_Action: Investigation authorized by Commission despite late filing
Legal_Basis: Violation of human rights on the basis of disability
